result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro Guzman Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Not called on the record. 10:31 AM Defendant Alejandro Guzman Hernandez in court.  Attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court for Alejandro Guzman Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cabranes requests a new date to allow state to get further discovery in this matter. 
State will work on getting the assigned ADA to forward discovery in this matter. 
Court will set a further date.
No interpreter appeared today.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:38 PM Defendant Alejandro Guzman Hernandez in court.  Attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court for Alejandro Guzman Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared in person as interpreter who is sworn in by the court. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Cabranes requests a further date along with discovery. 
State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:55 AM Defendant Alejandro Guzman Hernandez in court with attorney John Alexander Cabranes.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter and sworn in.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED AT NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:31 AM Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alejandro Guzman Hernandez in court with attorney John Alexander Cabranes.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter.  Attorney Osborne states the officer has not appeared and requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearing noting if this case is dismissed, the State would re-file.  Attorney Cabranes is not in objection to adjourning the preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns for preliminary hearing and time limits previously waived.  SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR NEXT DATE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
